author: cobblecat
title: East Africa Cardano Innovation Hub
description: La falta de un centro de coordinación y de un espacio para que los entusiastas de Cardano colaboren, está limitando el crecimiento de Cardano en África Oriental

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal states that the lack of a hub to coordinate spaces for collaboration is limiting Cardano's growth in Africa. The team proposes to address this problem by creating a community space designed to promote the sharing of experiences, learning, networking, and referrals for work, among others. With this simple explanation of the solution, the community can assess its alignment with the challenge. However, the team provides the necessary details, such as the target audience, success metrics aligned with the challenge and how they expect to achieve financial sustainability. I therefore rate them a 5.
f6_assessments.q1: A brief description of the skills and experience of the leader of the proposal is provided, with previous experience developing events in Cardano, as well as reference to his LinkedIn profile. As well as reference to the Endubis website, where they describe the projects in Ethiopia that they are gathering so far. In addition, I visited the website where they will physically gather, as well as the Facebook page. There, I saw different types of events for more than a year, which from my perspective adds credibility. One thing I have noticed is that the leader and other members of the team have several proposals in this catalyst cycle. Each of these proposals has its own purposes, and I consider it totally valid, however, it should be described which role each person will have and if part of the budget will be destined to hire external personnel that are not part of the team members. That way it makes sense to me as I find a balance in the burdens. I would also have appreciated it if more effort had been put into the budget description, even though it was broken down into identifiable items, I found gaps that make it difficult to assess with precision. For example, it would be great to have a description of the hourly cost of professionals in sections such as "Marketing", "Staff Salary", "Motivational Speakers and Trainers"; it is also unclear to me what they mean by "business meetups" since according to their proposal they are not part of their target audience. Finally, I congratulate the team for an excellent description of the phases through which they believe this project must pass in order to be economically sustainable.
f6_assessments.q2: In the auditability section of the proposal, the team makes commendable efforts. It describes a roadmap in 3 phases with the last one in April 2022 when they expect to be consolidated as a co-working space; it also describes the success metrics that the team expects to have. As far as I am concerned, they are appropriate and totally aligned with the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Building a local community hub in Ethiopia is a good idea. This proposal checks all the boxes in this challenge. The proposer has clearly described the project and the values that it can bring to the cardano ecosystem. The cardano hub can attract young students, developers, entrepreneurs etcc. that will come into the cardano ecosystem to build. Furthermore, the key metrics outlined by the proposer align perfectly with the spirit of the challenge. The scaling of the proposal for future challenges can be a matter of replicating the model in other places. There are many ways to scale this project if it turns out to be successful. (Rating 5)
f6_assessments.q1: This project is highly feasible according to the details provided by the proposer. The proposer has linked it's own linkedin profile which, after study, has resulted in an adequate profile capable of carrying out the project. The skills and the experiences needed are outlined in the profile of the proposer. The proposer has also provided a plan for future funds if needed after 12 months of operating successfully. By that time, if all goes well, the project should be able attract vc fundings. Furthermore, there is a timetable for the completion of the project. The proposer has provided all the details needed to fully grasp what the project is all about and all the resources needed to successfully execute the job. However I would like to see the consideration of potential risks and challenges this project may face. The proposer can take this as advice to further improve this proposal.(Rating 5)
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has provided a roadmap and the milestone needed to track the progress of the project. The Metrics and KPIs are also outlined in this proposal. The success of this project can be measured in 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months. I think that the proposer has done a great job in describing the problem, and the solution in this proposal.(Rating 5)

the proposal shows clearly how it going to add value to the cardano ecosystem, the key metrics and goals of the proposal has been stated clearly and falling in scope of the challenge..  
And throught this solution are scale to address future challengies.

the proposal has also listed how it team memebers are going to operate both in defferent and local languages needed to implement the proposal and team structure is locally laid down as well.

budget are been brocken down int reasonable items for the project if funded.

f6_assessments.q2:
Strogly agreed because the proposer has laid down good road maps for the project if funded so it can be easily audit.

The proposal also plans to deal with the problem because with this Endubis Hub will help people learn more about cardano and through this most communities will grow on cardano and there are contencies plan in place for various outcomes..

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is that the Cardano enthusiasts in East Africa don't have the space to coordinate and collaborate. The vision for this challenge is clear, and the results it brings can be very beneficial for Cardano.
The proponent clearly understands what needs to be done for the proposal. Creating a community hub to help people connect, share experiences, and learn from each other will help the Cardano ecosystem to expand and grow further in East Africa.
f6_assessments.q1:
As mentioned earlier, the scope, development results and success indicators have been carefully laid out.
The proponent details potential challenges and risks and establishes some measures to avoid them.
Do not provide information on how many members the proposed team includes, they will divide the work in this proposal. There was only a link to a member's LinkedIn page, however, no information was shared, making it difficult to verify the referrer's likelihood of being caught. So, although the presentation plan is perfect, they know well what they need to do, how to do it, but the team's information is not available, there is no basis to evaluate the team's true internal strength, so I disagree. idea. disagree about the possibility of the proposal
f6_assessments.q2:
On the plus side, there is a roadmap outlining how proponents plan to make their outreach program available to a wide audience.
The KPIs provided will provide the community with clear evidence to test and measure the progress of the proposal. The stated budget is reasonable enough, transparent in how costs are used. and for the reasons above, I completely agree that the team is competent enough to tackle the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal shows up clearly that their hub activities can help Cardano enthusiasts to collaborate with each other and grow Cardano community in East Africa - as this is within the challenge setting.
It also shows the key metrics in very detail with the number of participants and newbies to join Cardano. So this proposal will impact the development of Cardano community directly.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has very detailed info about: 
- Implementation plan in months with detail of works to do and goals to get. 
- KPI with clear numbers of people in specific space that they will get, and think it's realistic with the timeline and detail plan that they describe above.  
- Budget breakdown into pieces that related to their plan activities and timeline. 
- Detail information about activities and space, services that they will develop with further vision and short mission in the scope of this proposal. 
The only thing this proposal lack is the risk and how they can avoid it. But look at their team info and some events that held by them, I think it's not a big deal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has a good roadmap and detailed KPIs, key metrics that are enough for auditing it. In addition, the team also has its own website that I think will publish all the event information. 
The proposal also provides detailed info about their solution with vision and detailed activities, materials need for implementation so I think this proposal is clarified for us to vote.

solution: Un Hub diseñado para la colaboración; para que la gente comparta experiencias, aprenda de los demás y subcontrate o busque talento.
experience:
